com.audiofetch.afaudiolib.bll.colleagues

Class AudioController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.audiofetch.afaudiolib.bll.colleagues.base.ControllerBase
      • com.audiofetch.afaudiolib.bll.colleagues.AudioController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NativeController.OnDiscoveryFinishedListener

    public class AudioController
extends ControllerBase
implements NativeController.OnDiscoveryFinishedListener
    Wraps the relationship to all things related to audiofetch audio, including apb interaction, etc. Posts events via EventBus, which can be subscribed Subscribe to using these event classes:
    See Also:
    NativeController, SapaController, AudioFocusEvent, AudioStateEvent, AudioPreferenceChangeEvent, VolumeChangeEvent, ChannelSelectedEvent, - Actually, posted by WifiController, but worth noting here

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean abandonAudioFocus()
      Wraps call to AudioManager abandonAudioFocus with a boolean result
      static AudioController get()
      Singleton method to get the apb controller class
      int getApbAudioMode()
      Returns the mode identifier of either MODE_MONO(1), or MODE_STEREO(2) (default)
      AudioManager getAudioManager()
      Returns the android AudioManager service from the current context
      int getAudioMode()
      Returns 1 = mono, or 2 = stereo, or 0 if an error occurred trying to obtain audio mode NOTE: This information may be gotten from the json in new multi-mode, this fallback code needs to be preserved for legacy support of old firmware
      int getBufferedMs()
      Returns the current number of buffered ms
      int getBufferSize()
      Attempt to query the AudioManager to get the device's hardware buffer size
      java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getChannelList()
      Returns the list of channels present in the current system
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> getChannelListMap()
      Returns the mapping between host ip addresses and their corresponding channels
      java.lang.String getDeviceIp()
      Returns the ip address, or null if called before ip address is aquired NOTE: This information may be gotten from the json in new multi-mode, this fallback code needs to be preserved for legacy support of old firmware
      java.lang.String getDiscoveredApbs()
      Returns the Json array of discovered apb, json objects, or null
      static long getLastConnectTime()
      Stores the last time this device was successfully connected to a waio apb device
      static java.lang.String getLastGoodApbList()
      Returns the last good json string from the native layer, or null
      int getLastUserVolume()
      Returns last volume
      float getMaxVolume()
      Returns the max volume level configured for music as reported by AudioManager
      int getSampleRate()
      Attempts to queries the AudioManager for the devices default sample rate
      java.lang.String getSapaDiscoveredIps()
      Returns a Json array of discovered ip addresses, or null
      java.lang.String getSerialNumber()
      Returns serial number, or null if called before getAudioMode NOTE: This information may be gotten from the json in new multi-mode, this fallback code needs to be preserved for legacy support of old firmware
      float getStreamVolume()
      Returns the currently set stream volume level for music
      int getSystemVolume()
      Returns the volume, or -1 if unable to get the current volume level
      boolean hasAudioStream()
      Returns true if audio is running
      static void init(Context activity)
      Must be called prior to get
      boolean isAudioPlaying()
      Returns whether audio is streaming
      boolean isAudioSourceConnected()
      Returns true if currently connected to an apb
      boolean isDiscovering()
      Returns true if the app is in a state of discovering, false otherwise
      boolean isExpressDevice()
      Returns true if the connected APB is an express unit
      boolean isMuted()
      Returns true if volume == 0
      boolean isNativeAudioSession()
      Returns true if native OpenSL ES Audio is used, not sapa
      static boolean isPotentialSapaDevice()
      Returns true if Build.MANUFACTURER == ControllerBase.SAPA_MANUF
      boolean isSapaEnabled()
      DO NOT USE FOR SDK: Returns true if sapa is enabled in preferences
      boolean isSapaSession()
      DO NOT USE FOR SDK: Returns true if a sapa session was started
      AudioController muteAudio()
      Mutes audio

      Triggered by AudioManager, posts a AudioFocusEvent
      void onDestroy()
      Should be called from the Activity.onDestroy
      void onDiscoveryFinished(java.lang.String apbJsonArray)
      This is triggered when discovery has finished, and it posts a ChannelsReceivedEvent Note: This is called on a bg thread, so run any UI, or EventBus calls in mUiHandler

      Should be called from Activity.onKeyDown

      Restart / starts audio after it has been paused

      Sets the ms of buffer and sends it to the native code to adjust the compression

      Sets the channel

      Sets single operation mode flag

      Sets the last connect time to a timestamp value

      Sets the SeekBar to use as a volume control, so AudioController can become the SeekBar.OnSeekBarChangeListener, for the SeekBar
      AudioController setVolumeControlStream(Context ctx)
      Sets the correct volume control stream value for the activity to STREAM_MUSIC
      AudioController startAudio()
      Starts audio for the AudioFetch service

      Starts the native audio session using OpenSL ES, this is the fallback for Sapa phones, but the main audio session for any non-samsung device
